text:
Zootopia Toy Review! Hey guy's welcome to Genevieve's Playhouse
today we've got a toy figure set of the upcoming

movie Zootopia from Disney. These toys are
only available from the Disney store, but

if you don't have a Disney store available
to you, you can go on their website (www.disney.com)

and order it, which is what I did. Although
if you order it online you kind of run the

risk of what happened here on mine is that
by the time it got to me some of figures were

jostled out of their little moulds, so I had
to go in here fix them back, but other than

that ordering online is not too bad. Um, it's
got ten different figures, this set runs about

twenty dollars, although if you order it online,
it's an extra few bucks in shipping, but it's

not too bad for ten figures. So let's take
a look at these. Unfortunately it doesn't

have names of the characters on the box which
I really wish they would do, because all I

know about Zootopia right now is what I've
seen the previews. And the previews make it

look pretty hilarious, but it doesn't really
tell you all of the character names though.

Luckily we have the internet and I looked
them up. So I've already got the bottom flap

open which is probably the best way to open
it because you won't tear up the nice display

case that it comes in. And also you won't
cut yourself on the sharp plastic. Now we

can just lift the box up and they'll stay
in their mould hopefully. Here we go. He's

a closer look at these guys. You can see already
that they're really detailed figures. They

run from about 1" tall to maybe about 5" tall.
This one here, this is Judy Hopps, she is

the main character of the movie. She is the
first rabbit on the police force. I guess

because she's so small and non-threatening
that they don't think a rabbit would make

a good police officer. Alright we'll put her
right here. And they have another Judy Hopps

here. This is a kid version of her and you
can see that she's got a badge, so even as

a kid she was aspiring police officer. This
is the smallest of the figures. You can see

it's about an inch, inch and half tall. So
there's Judy. And I guess you all know from

the previews that the other main character
is the fox here. Some of these have metal

wires that need to be cut. This is Nick Wilde,
he's played by Jason Bateman in the movie.

He is a con artist but some series of events
he gets tied up with Judy and they have to

solve a case together. Again that's what I'm
piecing together from the previews that I've

seen. You can see he has kind of a mischievous
look. His hands are in the air as if to say

"I didn't do it" when it's clear that he probably
did. Actually his first appearance was actually

in Big Hero 6. They had a billboard in the
movie that had Nick Wilde on it. And also

one of the character's cell phones had a picture
of him on it. So they were planning this movie

even back then. Alright in the back here,
we've got Mayor Lionheart, he's the biggest

figure here. He's the mayor of Zootopia. He
was inspired by Mufasa from the Lion King,

that's who they modeled him after. Both in
appearance and demeanor. He's very heavy,

he's probably about 5 or 6 ounces. He's pretty
solid. Okay. Move them over so I can spread

them out a bit. And the Judy's. Here is what
appears to be an elephant, but you can see

it's much smaller than you would think an
elephant would be. It's actually the fennec

(Finnick) fox from the movie dressed up in
an elephant costume. So I'm not sure what

leads the fennec fox to need to put on an
elephant costume and hold a gigantic lollipop

and have a heart on his chest here. But I'm
curious as anyone to see when Zootopia comes

out. Here we have the sheep Miss. Bellwether.
She is Mayor Lionheart's secretary. She looks

kind of bookish with her kind of toned down
skirt -- dress here, and thick glasses. Alright

in the back here we've got this big boy. This
is Clawhauser. He is a cheetah. A very rotund

cheetah, little overweight. He's got a donut
in his hand and you can see he's got sprinkles

all over him so he enjoys his donuts more
than your average cop. And one little easter

egg I found out about him is that, if you
look here, he's got three little spots that

form a Mickey Mouse face, so he's kind of
like got a Micky Mouse birthmark. Supposedly

he likes food and the pop star Gazelle from
the movie. I don't know much about Gazelle

other than she's a pop star and unfortunately
they don't have a figure of her here. Okay

this is.... this is Yax. Um, you can see that
he has no clothes unlike any of the other

characters he is officially an animal nudist.
He's also kind of like a hippie, enlightened

guru type character. He's played by Tommy
Chong I think and if you know who that is

you kind of know maybe what to expect from
this character. You can see his dreadlocks

here cover up his face. I don't even know
how he can see. Maybe he doesn't see, maybe

that's what makes him enlightened. Alright
we've got two more figures. This one here

is probably one of my favorite ones so far
because the previews, I'm sure you guys are

familiar with the sloth in the DMV. This is
Flash, which of course is an ironic name,

because he is a sloth. But allegedly he is
the fastest sloth in all of DMV, and I've

seen him work and it's not very fast. But
if anyone's been to the DMV they know that

doing anything there will take all day. So
it's pretty appropriate to have a sloth working

there. And our last character is apparently
an arctic shrew. I had to look up what kind

of animal this is because it's kind of like
a bizarre looking mouse to me. Here he is

in his chair, this is Mr. Big. He's the crime
boss or a mafia type character. He's modeled

after, he's kind of a cross between Vito Corleone
from the Godfather and Tony Montana from Scarface.

Except in pint sized version of him. You can
see all of the detail, especially on the chair

here. It's got some gilt leaf work in there.
You can see the brass studs on the cushion,

he's got, you can see on the armrest there,
like a little carved mouse head. All of these

figures are really well detailed. That's one
thing that you can expect to get from Disney

figures, they don't skimp on the quality of
their coloring and their detail which I really

like. And the price really isn't that bad,
it's 10 figures for about 20 dollars, that's

two dollars, two dollars a toy, that's not
too bad. Okay here's a closer look at everybody

that we got. I'm pretty happy with these Zootopia
figures. The only thing that I was a little

disappointed in was that some of the figures
were a little jumbled up but that was because

I Ordered them online rather than pick them
up in store, and it was an easy fix anyway.

The box was easy to get in to without really
damaging the display. So that's pretty cool

and I'm really looking forward to the Zootopia
movie, I hope it's as funny as the previews

would suggest that it is. Alright guys thanks
for tuning in, and I hope you liked these

toys. I'll be looking for more zootopia stuff
as I find it. Alright, bye guys =)
